body_html:
For a speed reference, MKL (through scipy) does 4096x4096 SVD in 5.6 seconds on Xeon V4
Unexpectedly, symmetric eigenvalue version is considerably slower than full SVD scipy/scipy#7339

For a large enough matrix, it's going to be compute bound, so doing decomposition outside of TensorFlow and transferring using feed_dict would be not much slower than using native op
body_text:
For a speed reference, MKL (through scipy) does 4096x4096 SVD in 5.6 seconds on Xeon V4
Unexpectedly, symmetric eigenvalue version is considerably slower than full SVD scipy/scipy#7339
For a large enough matrix, it's going to be compute bound, so doing decomposition outside of TensorFlow and transferring using feed_dict would be not much slower than using native op
body:
For a speed reference, MKL (through scipy) does 4096x4096 SVD in 5.6 seconds on Xeon V4
Unexpectedly, symmetric eigenvalue version is considerably slower than full SVD https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/7339

For a large enough matrix, it's going to be compute bound, so doing decomposition outside of TensorFlow and transferring using `feed_dict` would be not much slower than using native op
